🇬🇧 We’ve got Brexit done.

Now it’s time to level up, unite the country and make 2020 a great year for everyone across the UK. 🇬🇧 https://t.co/7k3iRpkK0x

This evening we said goodbye to @DExEUgov. A Government department like no other, and a dedicated team of Ministers and civil servants. To everyone who worked in DExEU over its lifetime, a huge thank you - and good luck for wherever the next phase takes you #StarburstDExEU https://t.co/6q01g0tTG7

Heartfelt thanks to @NosheenaMobarik for her tireless work in Brussels on behalf of Scotland and @ScotTories over the years. A mould-breaking, ceiling-shattering, accomplished and dignified role model if ever there was one. Thank you.

It seems "Metropolitan" (1990) had its inception in the workings of an arcane 1970s pressure group. The hope-for revival of that form of dress did not come to pass -- at least not yet. https://t.co/CSpVTRENJl
Swimming UNDER the Antarctic ice-sheet was the most beautiful and terrifying experience imaginable. This is WHY I did it. Please share. #Antarctic2020 https://t.co/M1CsI4wa2Q

Today at PMQs- the Prime Minister committed to working with the oil & gas industry to make Aberdeen City & Shire no longer the simply oil & gas capital of Europe, but the Energy Capital of the World! #WestAberdeenshireandKincardine #PMQs https://t.co/DZc7e12bDO

Nicholas Parsons was a wonderful role model: always courteous, always good-humoured, always the professional & still at his best aged 95! I thought he was immortal because he was always so alive. Such sadness today, but what a career to celebrate, from the 1940s to 2020. My hero! https://t.co/w6kS796qry

Last year, the @JewishChron featured a five-part essay by our founder Maurice Glasman on the search for his grandfather's village in Ukraine. 

It is a moving account of family, history, love, and loss. May their names be blessed. #HolocaustMemorialDay https://t.co/Qqe4fc6QGI

I will never forget my visit to Auschwitz-Birkenau & we must never  forget the darkness of the Holocaust. I hope our online harms work will reinforce the fact there can be no place whether online or offline for any kind of anti-semitism or hatred #HMD2020 https://t.co/wHry3yyTEE

As we commemorate International Holocaust Memorial Day 75 years after the liberation of Auschwitz, we must all stop, pause, reflect &, most importantly, pledge to continue teaching current & future generations about these horrors, so that it never, ever happens again. #HMD2020 https://t.co/cEn9Wd0FRD

I took this image at Birkenau last year. Later this morning I will be attending a #HolocaustMemorialDay service @SurreyCouncil. Visit my facebook page to read a blog I wrote and reposted this morning, following my trip to Auschwitz-Birkenau @HMD_UK @yadvashem @Surreyheath https://t.co/PZdjNNPlgg

"The catastrophic drop in attainment...presents us with  possibility of Scotland lacking new scientists, teachers, doctors, nurses.
"It should be a matter of national concern that levels of 'zero attainment' have risen sharply and that this has reached over 3% (effectively, one child in every S1 comprehensive class)..."
Prof Scott says: "Least able and 'lower-average' learners have suffered to a significantly greater extent than the able, and particularly the most able, in S4.

Prof Scott also found the number of Higher passes in S5 has dropped by 10% in past four years - a reduction, the report claims, "Scotland cannot afford". He says every set of learners has seen a negative impact, but worst affected pupils were those who are "less than average".

Looking at national, local authority and individual school data, Prof Scott found attainment in Scottish national qualification levels three to five in S4 pupils has dropped by at least 32.9% for each level since CfE was introduced in 2013.
